thread.title: Chedzoy, Watkins Glen/O-M hold off Groton, 42-12

title: Chedzoy, Watkins Glen/O-M hold off Groton, 42-12
text:
Chedzoy, Watkins Glen/O-M hold off Groton, 42-12 Tom Fleischman, tfleischman@ithacajournal.com | @TomF_IJSports 11:43 p.m. EDT October 16, 2015 Buy Photo The Seneca Indians defeated Groton 42-12 Friday evening in Groton. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo The Seneca Indians Ian Chedzoy carries the ball for a first down as Groton's Dione Martin can't bring him down during the first half of their game Friday evening in Groton. Interception by Jordan Rappleye for the Seneca Indians. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Seneca Indians vs Groton football. Interception by Jordan Rappleye for the Seneca Indians. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Seneca Indians vs Groton football SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Seneca Indians vs Groton football. Groton's Dylan Cooper makes and interception before returning the ball to the three yard line. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Seneca Indians vs Groton football SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Seneca Indians vs Groton football SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Ryan Pruitt (24) of Watkins Glen/Odessa-Montour looks for room to run as Groton's Kyle Howser closes in for the tackle on Friday at Groton. The visiting Seneca Indians won, 42-12. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Seneca Indians vs Groton football SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Seneca Indians vs Groton football. 2 point conversion to make it 8-0. SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Seneca Indians vs Groton football SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay The host Indians made a run in the second half, but fullback Ian Chedzoy and Watkins Glen/O-M responded with three touchdowns in the fourth quarter to pull away for a 30-point non-division road win. Buy Photo Ryan Pruitt (24) of Watkins Glen/Odessa-Montour looks for room to run as Groton's Kyle Howser closes in for the tackle on Friday at Groton. The visiting Seneca Indians won, 42-12. (Photo: SIMON WHEELER / Staff Photo) Buy Photo Story Highlights Senior fullback Ian Chedzoy carried 24 times for 149 yards and scored five touchdowns for WG/O-M Junior running back Matt Gombas led Groton with 104 yards and a touchdown on 19 carries The Seneca Indians will take on Lansing next Saturday for the Section 4 Divison V title Groton advances to the Section 4 Class D playoffs, against an opponent to be determined 8 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Early in the second half, the Groton football team appeared poised to make theirs a happy homecoming. 
The Indians had just scored their second consecutive touchdown to get to within eight points of visiting Watkins Glen/Odessa-Montour, then recovered the ensuing onside kick, much to the delight of the partisan Ross Field crowd. 
But the hosts were unable to sustain the momentum, and the Seneca Indians started feeding Groton a steady diet of burly fullback Ian Chedzoy. The result was a 42-12 victory for Watkins Glen/O-M on Friday night in a battle of Section 4 Conference division leaders. 
Chedzoy finished the game with 149 yards and five touchdowns on 24 carries as the Seneca Indians (6-1 overall, 2-0 Div. V) extended their win streak to six games since a season-opening loss to Owego. WG/O-M has outscored its last three opponents, 161-34. 
"The lineman did a great job of blocking the line and getting me into the secondary," Chedzoy said. "Once I got my momentum going, I could just keep my legs moving and I seemed to get some yards." 
Chedzoy admitted that, when Groton made its run early in the second half, he was feeling a little sense of deja vu. 
"I felt like this might have been the old Watkins," he said. "We did that last year a couple of times, scored big in the first half and let teams come back. But then we just pulled it back together, fixed it on defense and started doing what we do." 
Junior running back Matt Gombas rushed 19 times for 104 yards and a score for Groton (4-3, 3-1 Div. VIII), which trailed 14-0 after one quarter and 20-0 before junior Dylan Cooper's 5-yard run made it 20-6 with 1 1/2 minutes left in the first half. 
Chedzoy scored on a pair of 1-yard runs in the first quarter to put the visitors on top early. Then following the first of three interceptions by Groton quarterback Daimon Shoemaker (6-for-23, 88 yards), Chedzoy capped a 24-yard drive with a 3-yard plunge to put the Seneca Indians up by 20. 
The 5-8, 180-pound Chedzoy added scoring runs of 8 and 7 yards in the fourth quarter, and was the featured back for much of the second half as he gained all but 39 of his yards after the break. Senior defensive back Chris Foote capped the scoring when he picked off a Shoemaker pass near midfield and sprinted up the left sideline to the end zone with 3:45 to play. 
Watkins Glen/O-M is scheduled to play host to Lansing (4-3, 2-0 Div. V) next Saturday night, with the winner taking the Division V championship. 
"That's been my goal for the four years I've been playing football," Chedzoy said, referring to winning a division title. "It feels great to have a chance to do that." 
Lansing was forced to forfeit its game with Chenango Forks on Friday due to an insufficient number of healthy players. Lansing director of athletics Adam Heck said he will re-evaluate the team's health situation on Monday. 
Groton's next game is in the first round of the Section 4 Class D playoffs, next weekend against an opponent to be determined. 8 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://ithacajr.nl/1LyXlGe TOP VIDEOS
